railroads.name: Atchison, Topeka, and Santa Fe
railroads.outcome: Merged with Burlington Northern to become BNSF

railroads.name: Atlantic Coast Line
railroads.outcome: Merged with Seaboard Air Line to form the Seaboard Coast Line

railroads.name: Baltimore and Ohio
railroads.outcome: Taken over by the Chesapeake & Ohio to become the Chessie System

railroads.name: Boston and Maine
railroads.outcome: Purchased by Pan Am Systems

railroads.name: Chesapeake and Ohio
railroads.outcome: Renamed to Chessie System

railroads.name: Chicago, Burlington and Quincy
railroads.outcome: Merged with Great Northern, Northern Pacific and Spokane, Portland & Seattle to form Burlington Northern

railroads.name: Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul, and Pacific
railroads.outcome: Acquired by the Soo Line Railroad

railroads.name: Chicago, Rock Island, and Pacific
railroads.outcome: Liquidated

railroads.name: Chicago and North Western
railroads.outcome: Merged into Union Pacific

railroads.name: Denver and Rio Grande Western
railroads.outcome: Renamed to Southern Pacific after purchasing that railroad

railroads.name: Great Northern
railroads.outcome: Merged with Chicago, Burlington & Quincy, Northern Pacific and Spokane, Portland & Seattle to form Burlington Northern

railroads.name: Gulf, Mobile and Ohio
railroads.outcome: Merged with Illinois Central to form Illinois Central Gulf

railroads.name: Illinois Central
railroads.outcome: Acquired by Canadian National

railroads.name: Louisville and Nashville
railroads.outcome: Merged with Seaboard Coast Line to create Seaboard System Railroad

railroads.name: Missouri Pacific
railroads.outcome: Merged with Union Pacific

railroads.name: New York, New Haven, and Hartford
railroads.outcome: Merged into Penn Central

railroads.name: New York Central
railroads.outcome: Merged with Pennsylvania Railroad to form Penn Central

railroads.name: Norfolk and Western
railroads.outcome: Merged with Southern Railway to create Norfolk Southern

railroads.name: Northern Pacific
railroads.outcome: Merged with Chicago, Burlington & Quincy, Great Northern and Spokane, Portland & Seattle to form Burlington Northern

railroads.name: Pennsylvania
railroads.outcome: Merged with New York Central to form Penn Central

railroads.name: Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac
railroads.outcome: Now part of CSX

railroads.name: Seaboard Air Line
railroads.outcome: Merged with Atlantic Coast Line to form the Seaboard Coast Line

railroads.name: Southern Pacific
railroads.outcome: Purchased by Rio Grande Industries but retained Southern Pacific name, later purchased by Union Pacific

railroads.name: Southern Railway
railroads.outcome: Merged with Norfolk & Western to create Norfolk Southern

railroads.name: St. Louis & San Francisco
railroads.outcome: Acquired by Burlington Northern

railroads.name: Texas and Pacific
railroads.outcome: Merged with the Missouri Pacific

railroads.name: Union Pacific
railroads.outcome: Currently operating

railroads.name: Western Pacific
railroads.outcome: Acquired by Union Pacific
